1.verse: Paul and Silvanus and Timothy to the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace.

2.verse: We Give Thanks For Your Faith And Love And Endurance - We are giving-thanks to God always for you all while making mention of you in our prayers, unceasingly

3.verse: remembering your work of  faith and labor of love and endurance of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ before our God and Father;

4.verse: knowing, brothers having been loved by God, your election,

5.verse: because our good-news did not come to you in word only, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with great fullness-of-conviction— just as you know what-kind-of men we proved-to-be among you for your sake.

6.verse: For You Became Imitators of Us And Examples To All - And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, having accepted the word in much affliction with the joy of the Holy Spirit,

7.verse: so that you became an example to all the ones believing in Macedonia and in Achaia.

8.verse: For from you the word of the Lord has sounded-forth— not only in Macedonia and in Achaia, but in every place your faith toward God has gone-out— so that we are having no need to speak anything!

9.verse: For they themselves are reporting about us as to what-sort-of entrance we had with you, and how you turned to God from idols to be serving the living and true God,

10.verse: and to be awaiting His Son from the heavens Whom He raised from the dead— Jesus, the One delivering us from the coming wrath.

1.verse: You Know What Kind of Men We Were Among You When We Brought God’s Message To You - For you yourselves know our entrance to you, brothers— that it has not been empty.

2.verse: But having previously-suffered and been mistreated in Philippi, as you know, we were bold in our God to speak the good-news of God to you in a great conflict.

3.verse: For our exhortation is not from error, nor from impurity, nor in deceit.

4.verse: But just as we have been approved by God to be entrusted-with the good-news, so we speak— not as pleasing people, but God, the One testing our hearts.

5.verse: For neither did we at-any-time come with a word of flattery, as you know; nor with a pretext for greed— God is witness;

6.verse: nor seeking glory from people— neither from you, nor from others,

7.verse: [although] being able to be with weight as apostles of Christ. But we proved-to-be child-like in your midst. As when a nurse cherishes her children,

8.verse: in this manner longing-affectionately for you, we were well-pleased to impart to you not only the good-news of God, but also our own lives, because you became beloved ones to us.

9.verse: For you remember, brothers, our labor and hardship— working by night and by day so-as not to be a burden-on any of you, we proclaimed to you the good-news of God.

10.verse: You and God are witnesses how devoutly and righteously and blamelessly we were with you, the ones believing—

11.verse: just-as you know how each one of you, as a father his own children,

12.verse: we were exhorting you and encouraging and testifying so-that you might walk worthily of God, the One calling you into His own kingdom and glory.

13.verse: And We Thank God You Accepted Our Message As God’s Word, Even Amidst Persecution - And for this reason we are indeed giving-thanks to God unceasingly: because having received the word of God heard from us, you accepted not the word of humans, but, as it truly is, the word of God, which also is at-work in you, the ones believing.

14.verse: For you became imitators, brothers, of the churches of God existing in Judea in Christ Jesus, because you also suffered the same things by your own countrymen as they also by the Jews—

15.verse: the ones also having killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and having driven us out, and not being pleasing to God, and being contrary to all people,

16.verse: forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles in order that they might be saved, so that they fill-up the measure of their sins always. But the wrath came upon them to the uttermost.

17.verse: We Sent Timothy To Establish You Amidst Your Afflictions, And That I Might Know Your Faith - And we, brothers, having been orphaned from you for a season of an hour in face, not in heart, were more eager with great desire to see your face.

18.verse: Because we wanted to come to you— I, Paul, both once and twice— and Satan hindered us.

19.verse: For what is our hope or joy or crown of boasting— or is it not indeed you!— before our Lord Jesus at His coming?

20.verse: For you are our glory and joy.

1.verse: Therefore, bearing it no longer, we preferred to be left-behind in Athens alone,

2.verse: and we sent Timothy, our brother and a fellow-worker of God in the good-news of Christ, so that he might establish you and encourage you concerning your faith,

3.verse: that no one might be disturbed by these afflictions. For you yourselves know that we are appointed for this.

4.verse: For even when we were with you, we were telling you beforehand that we were going to be afflicted, just as indeed it happened, and just as you know.

5.verse: For this reason, and I bearing it no longer, I sent Timothy so as to know your faith— that the one tempting had not somehow tempted you and our labor proved-to-be in vain.

6.verse: Timothy Now Returned With Encouraging News About Your Faith And Love. I Am Rejoicing! - And Timothy having just-now come to us from you, and having announced-the-good-news to us as to your faith and love, and that you have a good remembrance of us always, yearning to see us just as we also you—

7.verse: because of this, brothers, we were encouraged over you in all our distress and affliction, through your faith.

8.verse: Because now we live!— if you are standing-firm in the Lord.

9.verse: For what thanksgiving can we return to God for you for all the joy with which we are-rejoicing because of you before our God?—

10.verse: while praying super-abundantly by night and by day that we may see your face and complete the things lacking from your faith.

11.verse: May God And Our Lord Jesus Guide Our Ways And Cause Us To Abound In Love - Now may our God and Father Himself and our Lord Jesus direct our way to you.

12.verse: And may the Lord cause you to increase and abound in love for one another and for everyone (just as we also for you),

13.verse: so that He may establish your hearts so as to be blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all His holy ones. Amen.

1.verse: Brothers, We Ask You To Abound Even More In Holiness, For This Is God’s Will - Finally then, brothers, we ask you, and exhort in the Lord Jesus that just as you received from us how you ought-to be walking and pleasing God (just as you also are walking), that you be abounding more.

2.verse: For you know what commands we gave to you through the Lord Jesus.

3.verse: For this is the will of God: your holiness— that you be abstaining from sexual-immorality;

4.verse: that each of you know-how to acquire control of his own vessel in holiness and honor,

5.verse: not in the passion of  desire as indeed the Gentiles not knowing God;

6.verse: that no one overstep and exploit his brother in the matter. Because the Lord is the avenger concerning all these things, just as we also told you before and solemnly-warned.

7.verse: For God did not call us for impurity, but in holiness.

8.verse: So-therefore the one rejecting is not rejecting a human, but God, the One also giving His Holy Spirit to you.

9.verse: But You Know From God To Love One Another. We Exhort You To Abound Even More - But concerning brotherly-love, you have no need that anyone should be writing to you. For you yourselves are God-taught so-that you might be loving one another.

10.verse: For indeed you are doing it toward all the brothers in all Macedonia. But we exhort you, brothers, to be abounding more,

11.verse: and to be ambitious to be quiet, and to be doing your own things and working with your own hands just as we commanded you,

12.verse: in order that you may walk properly toward the ones outside and may have need of nothing.

13.verse: Do Not Grieve Over The Dead In Christ. We Will Rise Together To Be With Him Forever - And we do not want you to be unaware, brothers, concerning the ones falling-asleep, in-order-that you may not grieve as indeed the others— the ones not having a hope.

14.verse: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose-up, so also God will bring with Him the ones having fallen asleep through Jesus.

15.verse: For we say this to you by the word of the Lord, that we— the ones living, the ones remaining until the coming of the Lord— will in-no-way precede the ones having fallen asleep.

16.verse: Because the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shouted-command, with a voice of an archangel, and with a trumpet of God, and the dead in Christ will rise-up first.

17.verse: Then we— the ones living, the ones remaining— will be snatched-up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And so we shall always be with the Lord.

18.verse: So then, be encouraging one another with these words.

1.verse: But You Know The Day of The Lord Will Come Like a Thief In The Night. Keep Watching - But concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need that anything should be written to you.

2.verse: For you yourselves accurately know that the day of the Lord comes in this manner— like a thief in the night.

3.verse: When they are saying “peace and security”, then unexpected destruction suddenly-comes-upon them, just as the birth-pain on the one having a child in the womb. And they will by no means escape.

4.verse: But you, brothers, are not in darkness, so that the day should overtake you like a thief.

5.verse: For you all are sons of  light and sons of day. We are not of night, nor of darkness.

6.verse: So then, let us not be sleeping like the others, but let us be keeping-watch and being sober.

7.verse: For the ones sleeping are sleeping at night. And the ones getting-drunk are-drunk at night.

8.verse: But let us, being of the day, be sober, having put on a breastplate of faith and love, and a helmet: the hope of salvation.

9.verse: Because God did not appoint us for wrath, but for the obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ—

10.verse: the One having died for us in order that whether we are keeping-watch or sleeping, we may live together with Him.

11.verse: Therefore be encouraging one another and building-up one the other, just as you are also doing.

12.verse: Esteem Your Leaders in Love - And we ask you, brothers, to know the ones laboring among you and leading you in the Lord and admonishing you,

13.verse: and to be esteeming them super-abundantly in love because of their work. Be living-in-peace among yourselves.

14.verse: Closing Exhortations - Now we exhort you, brothers— be admonishing the disorderly ones, be encouraging the fainthearted ones, be holding-on-to the weak ones, be patient with everyone.

15.verse: See that no one gives-back evil for evil to anyone, but always be pursuing the good, both for one another and for everyone.

18.verse: be giving-thanks in everything. For this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.

19.verse: Do not be quenching the Spirit,

20.verse: do not be treating prophecies with contempt,

21.verse: but be testing all things. Be holding-on-to the good,

22.verse: be abstaining from every form of evil.

23.verse: Now may the God of peace Himself sanctify you wholly. And may your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blamelessly at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

24.verse: Faithful is the One calling you, Who also will do it.

25.verse: Brothers, be praying also for us.

26.verse: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.

27.verse: I adjure you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the brothers.

28.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
